start: ^You've received alerts: Integration with DH is broken! Some data from specific vendors is missing. Your heart skips a beat, your palms get sweaty, and your coffee suddenly tastes cold. It's another on-call adventure! üò±
^Acknowledge like a Hero engineer. (Time to save the day!)
^No, I‚Äôm busy coding. Someone else will pick this up, right? (Don't be that person!)
check_customer_impact_question: ^Is there any order loss or poor customer experience? Are customers seeing blank screens? ü§Ø
^Q: How to check if there is order impact? (Quick, check the dashboards!)
check_customer_impact_answer: ^We can check the impact on orders by checking the Shopping Dashboard. (Fingers crossed!)
^No drop in orders, but customer experience might be impacted. Time to dig deeper. (That's a relief, but the mystery continues...)
create_incident: ^Yes, let's shed some light on this data darkness!
^No, let's keep it our little secret. (But secrets have a way of getting out...)
^No, I‚Äôve had enough post-mortems for a lifetime.
create_incident_answer: ^It‚Äôs a customer-facing endpoint. Let‚Äôs document it. (Transparency is the best policy!)
^No need. I‚Äôll fix it before anyone even notices. (Are you sure you're not underestimating the problem?)
page_team: ^You need more insights into the business logic and DH integration. (Time to phone a friend!)
^Page the team. Collaboration is key! (Two heads are better than one!)
^I‚Äôll figure it out on my own. Who needs a team?
team_response: ^The team mentions that DH calls their service through an API Gateway backed by a Lambda function. (Aha! A clue!)
^Ignore. I prefer to stay in the dark.
check_release_question: ^Was there a new release? (Did someone deploy a ticking time bomb? üí£)
^Q: How to check if there is a new release correlated?
^Not sure. Let me check the deployment logs later.
check_release_answer: ^We can check for a new release by:
^Checking tlb_production_deployments Slack Channel (Any deployment confessions?)
^Checking ArgoCD (Any rogue deployments?)
^Nope, no new releases today. (That's one less thing to worry about!)
check_fwf_question: ^Were any FWF flags recently enabled? (Did someone flip the wrong switch? üéöÔ∏è)
^I have no idea. FWF is a mystery to me.
check_fwf_answer: ^We can check FWF updates by looking at the FWF Slack Channel. (Hopefully, there are no surprises there!)
^Nope, all flags are unchanged. (That's a relief!)
check_cloudwatch: ^Check CloudWatch metrics for the API Gateway and Lambda logs? (Time to dive into the logs!)
^Metrics look good. No increase in error rates. (That's a good sign!)
^Who has time for metrics? Let‚Äôs skip to conclusions.
check_client_response: ^The client (DH) response shows 5xx errors originating from Cloudflare.
^Acknowledge. Time to dive into Cloudflare details.
check_cloudflare: ^Is the endpoint public and behind Cloudflare? (Is Cloudflare playing hide-and-seek?)
^Yes, it‚Äôs public. Cloudflare might be the culprit.
analyze_cloudflare: ^Check the Cloudflare analysis dashboard. (Time to put on your Cloudflare detective hat!)
^Yes, I‚Äôm on it. (The truth is out there!)
^I don‚Äôt have access to Cloudflare. This is someone else‚Äôs problem.
escalate_to_security: ^Increase in 5xx errors is related to Cloudflare rules. What‚Äôs next?
^Escalate to Talabat Security and page them to assist.
monitor_whitelisting: ^Monitor after the security team adds a whitelisting rule. (Fingers crossed it works!)
^Yes, let‚Äôs ensure the errors subside. (Don't let your guard down yet!)
update_incident: ^Update the incident? (Let's keep everyone in the loop!)
^No, I‚Äôm too busy enjoying my newfound peace.
close_incident: ^Close the incident? (Is it time to celebrate?)
^Yes, DH integration is back on track. Job well done!
^No, I‚Äôll leave it open for dramatic effect.
post_incident: ^üéâ **Victory!** You‚Äôve resolved the DH integration issue and restored vendor data flow. Everyone applauds your engineering prowess. Take a bow! üèÜ
incident_neglect_start: ^üíÄ **Disaster strikes!** The issue escalates, stakeholders are panicking, and your inbox explodes with angry messages. Better luck next time.
^Try again? (Maybe this time you'll listen to the customers!)
incident_neglect_check_customer_impact: ^üíÄ Oh no! Ignoring the customer impact was a grave mistake. Users are rioting on Twitter and your manager is breathing down your neck. Time to face the music! üé∂
^Try again? (Maybe this time you'll listen to the customers!)
incident_neglect_create_incident: ^üíÄ Oh dear! Hiding the incident didn't make it go away. Now it's a full-blown crisis, and everyone is pointing fingers. Transparency is key, my friend! üôà
^Try again? (Let's be open and honest this time!)
incident_neglect_page_team: ^üíÄ Going solo was a bad call! The issue escalated, and now you're lost in a maze of code with no escape. Remember, teamwork makes the dream work! ü§ù
incident_neglect_team_response: ^üíÄ Ignoring the team's wisdom was a recipe for disaster. Now the API Gateway is throwing a tantrum, and the Lambda function is singing the blues. Time to listen to the experts! üëÇ
incident_neglect_check_release: ^üíÄ The delayed release check caused chaos, and now the code is a tangled mess. Don't delay, act today! ‚è∞
^Try again? (Let's check those logs right away!)
incident_neglect_check_fwf: ^üíÄ Ignoring the FWF flags was a fatal flaw. Now the system is in a frenzy, and the data is dancing a chaotic jig. Time to face the FWF music! üï∫
incident_neglect_check_cloudwatch: ^üíÄ Skipping the metrics was a shortcut to disaster. Now the logs are overflowing, and the dashboards are flashing red. Time to embrace the power of metrics! üìä
^Try again? (Let's dive into those CloudWatch logs!)
incident_neglect_check_client_response: ^üíÄ Ignoring the client response was a critical error. Now the 5xx errors are multiplying like rabbits, and the customers are hopping mad. Time to acknowledge the problem! üêá
incident_neglect_check_cloudflare: ^üíÄ Guessing is not a debugging strategy! Now the Cloudflare gremlins are wreaking havoc, and the data is lost in the cloud. Time to get some answers! ‚òÅÔ∏è
^Try again? (Let's find out if Cloudflare is friend or foe!)
incident_neglect_analyze_cloudflare: ^üíÄ Passing the buck to someone else won't solve the problem. Now the Cloudflare mystery remains unsolved, and the data is still missing. Time to take responsibility! detective
^Try again? (Let's put on our Cloudflare detective hats!)
incident_neglect_escalate_to_security: ^üíÄ Ignoring security is like leaving the front door open. Now the data is vulnerable, and the hackers are having a field day. Time to call in the security experts! üö®
incident_neglect_monitor_whitelisting: ^üíÄ Overconfidence strikes again! The whitelisting rule didn't quite do the trick, and the errors are back with a vengeance. Don't celebrate too early! üéâ
incident_neglect_update_incident: ^üíÄ Silence is not golden when it comes to incidents. Now the stakeholders are in the dark, and rumors are spreading like wildfire. Time to communicate! üî•
incident_neglect_close_incident: ^üíÄ Prolonging the drama won't solve anything. Now the incident is dragging on, and everyone is losing patience. Time to close the curtain! üé≠
^Try again? (Let's declare victory and move on!)
